rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:   +
{{see also|ISO image}}
  +   +
The following is a list of software programs that can read and/or write '''[[ISO image]]''' files broken down by platform support and capability. Capability is defined as ability to create, mount, burn, and/or extract as follows:
  +
* '''Create''', the ability to create a new ISO file.
  +
* '''Edit''', the ability to manipulate the contents of an existing ISO file.
  +
* '''Mount''', the ability to mount an ISO image and emulate a disc volume.
  +
* '''Burn''', the ability to burn an ISO file to an [[Optical Disc]].
  +
* '''Extract''', the ability to copy the contents of the ISO file to a hard disk.
  +   +

! {{rh}} | lofiadm<sup>(1)</sup>
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| {{?}}
  +
| [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]]
  +
| {{?}}
  +
|
  +
|}
  +   +
'''(1)''' Command to manage files as block devices. Use to create a loopback device for an ISO image file suitable for mounting with <code>lofiadm -a /path/to/iso /dev/lofi/<em>X</em></code>. Mount the loopback device as a randomly accessible [[file system]] with <code>mount -F hsfs -o ro /dev/lofi/<em>X</em> /mnt/point</code>. Alternatively, use this combined format: <code>mount -F hsfs -o ro `lofiadm -a /path/to/iso` /mnt/point</code>.
  +   +
[[Category:Disk images]]
  +
[[Category:Lists of software|ISO image software]]
